item.title: Task-induced brain state manipulation improves prediction of individual traits
item.description: Recent work has begun to relate individual differences in brain functional organization to human behaviors and cognition, but the best brain state to reveal such relationships remains an open question.

item.title: Functional connectome fingerprinting: identifying individuals using patterns of brain connectivity
item.description: Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) studies typically collapse data from many subjects, but brain functional organization varies between individuals.
